author: Special Correspondent
text:
The District Rural Development Agency has taken up work on the construction of three bridges with a view to benefiting residents of a cluster of villages.

The bridges will come up across Puththar in Eravanchery village panchayat, Arasalar in Idaiyathankudi, and Arasalur in Ervadi village panchayat.

The bridge will come up at an estimate of Rs. 1.55 crore, across Puththar, Rs. 2.14 crore at Idaiyathankudi and Rs. 2.14 crore across Ervadi.

K.A. Jayapal, Minister for Fisheries, who laid the foundation for these bridges on Sunday, said these bridges were the felt need of the villagers.

The bridge in Puththar would benefit residents of Devankudi, Eravanchery, Nattarmangalam and Mathiyakudi.

The second bridge would cater to the needs of Ervadi, Kottapadi, Paramanallur, and Ganapathiapuram.

The bridge at Idaiyathankudi would link the villages Ervadi, Kottapadi, Kuruppur, Marudhavur, and Nathapalur.

S. Palanisamy, District Collector, said the bridges would be built under the funds sanctioned by the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development.
title: Work on three bridges launched
